name: places/ChIJhWasiORYwokRQraK1nkjK-8
formattedAddress: 909 3rd Ave Ofc, New York, NY 10022, USA
adrFormatAddress: 909 3rd Ave Ofc, New York, NY 10022, USA

originalText.text:
Have you ever been to the depths of hell?

Now you can! Upon arrival to this dump we attempted to use the self service devices in a room that was blasting heat and covers n garbage. We were unable to use this service due to there being no provided packaging.

So onward we went up the escalator into a large room with a missing ceiling. We went to the self service desk to get stickers and fill out forms. There were no pens provided or available for use.

Then we got in line and waited and waited and waited. Only to arrive at a usps worker who told us our package was in the wrong colored envelope. We had to go grab another. Anyways I bought a bunch of cute stamps for 36 dollars prolly a rip off, but whatever.

I wouldn’t electively come here again only out of necessity. The ceiling falling down is a nice touch.

originalText.text: This post office is a disgrace. Waited on line for nearly a half hour just to get a Priority mail express envelope (had a label but they didn’t have any mailing envelopes out for use); the teller at window 9 made me buy tape but wouldn’t wait for the 15 seconds it would take to tape the label on. She told me drop off at an unattended window. That was last night and my priority mail express package has not been mailed, the teller today says the teller last night should have scanned it and that she has no idea where my package is now and to “wait and see” what happens. As though people pay for priority mail express for fun. Do yourselves a favor and avoid this place if you can.

originalText.text:
This post office is located on the second floor and accessible via an escalator. Since it's walking distance from my office, I come here from time to time. Aside from the standard services, I enjoy the artwork on display along with some artifacts here and there. Also, this office is very spacious!

If you're not in a rush, check out the items they have on display!

originalText.text: Depths of hell is the correct description for what I experienced today. People lined up for morning appointments and no one was behind the desk. Turns out the passport woman doesn’t come in til later but we had to go bother the other staff twice to find this out. They will just let people wait around in a line for nothing. Then she finally shows up and she’s angry at people as if it’s OUR fault that the system allowed appts outside of her hours. Proceeded to scream at me just for approaching her window to ask a question, before I even said anything. You don’t have to be nice but at least be CIVIL??? I dealt with someone else and at the end I messed up my passport application, totally my own fault, but I wasn’t angry at them for it because I’m not a crazy person. Just don’t go in here expecting things to operate on logic, or to be treated like a human being.

originalText.text: Very rude and unhelpful manager. Employees make zero eye contact, and toss paperwork at you as if you’re causing them the world’s greatest inconvenience just for being there. I understand it’s a government run operation but I think the US post office should hold itself to a higher standard and treat its costumers like people. Other countries have a better customer service reputation. It is a shame the US Post office doesn’t.
